intro: Brassica oleracea var. aloides, commonly known as the curly kale, is a cultivated variety of the cabbage family. It is characterized by its dense, spoon-shaped leaves that are typically green or purple in color. The plant is an annual or biennial herb that thrives in cool climates and is often grown for its edible leaves. It requires well-drained soil and moderate moisture for optimal growth. The leaves are rich in nutrients and are widely used in culinary applications around the world.
